    Big operators #

    In this file we define products and sums indexed by finite sets (specifically, Finset).

    Notation #

    We introduce the following notation, localized in BigOperators. To enable the notation, use open BigOperators.

    Let s be a Finset , and f : a function.

    • x in s, f x is notation for Finset.prod s f (assuming is a CommMonoid)
    • x in s, f x is notation for Finset.sum s f (assuming is an AddCommMonoid)
    • x, f x is notation for Finset.prod Finset.univ f (assuming is a Fintype and is a CommMonoid)
    • x, f x is notation for Finset.sum Finset.univ f (assuming is a Fintype and is an AddCommMonoid)

    Implementation Notes #

    The first arguments in all definitions and lemmas is the codomain of the function of the big operator. This is necessary for the heuristic in @[to_additive]. See the documentation of to_additive.attr for more information.

    source
    def Finset.sum { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} [AddCommMonoid ] (s : Finset ) (f : ) :

    x in s, f x is the sum of f x as x ranges over the elements of the finite set s.

    Equations
    • Finset.sum s f = Multiset.sum (Multiset.map f s.val)
    Instances For
      source
      def Finset.prod { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} [CommMonoid ] (s : Finset ) (f : ) :

      x in s, f x is the product of f x as x ranges over the elements of the finite set s.

      Equations
      • Finset.prod s f = Multiset.prod (Multiset.map f s.val)
      Instances For
        source
        @[simp]
        theorem Finset.sum_mk { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} [AddCommMonoid ] (s : Multiset ) (hs : Multiset.Nodup s) (f : ) :
        Finset.sum { val := s, nodup := hs } f = Multiset.sum (Multiset.map f s)
        source
        @[simp]
        theorem Finset.prod_mk { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} [CommMonoid ] (s : Multiset ) (hs : Multiset.Nodup s) (f : ) :
        Finset.prod { val := s, nodup := hs } f = Multiset.prod (Multiset.map f s)
        source
        @[simp]
        theorem Finset.sum_val { : Type u_3} [AddCommMonoid ] (s : Finset ) :
        Multiset.sum s.val = Finset.sum s id
        source
        @[simp]
        theorem Finset.prod_val { : Type u_3} [CommMonoid ] (s : Finset ) :
        Multiset.prod s.val = Finset.prod s id

                    The difference with Finset.sum_nbij is that the bijection is allowed to use membership of the domain of the sum, rather than being a non-dependent function.

                    Taking a sum over univ.pi t is the same as taking the sum over Fintype.piFinset t. univ.pi t and Fintype.piFinset t are essentially the same Finset, but differ in the type of their element, univ.pi t is a Finset ( a univ, t a) and Fintype.piFinset t is a Finset ( a, t a).

                                  Deprecated lemmas #

                                  Those lemmas were deprecated on the 2023/12/23.

                                  source
                                  @[deprecated Fintype.prod_equiv]
                                  theorem Equiv.prod_comp' { : Type u_6} { : Type u_7} { : Type u_8} [Fintype ] [Fintype ] [CommMonoid ] (e : ) (f : ) (g : ) (h : (x : ), f x = g (e x)) :
                                  (Finset.prod Finset.univ fun (x : ) => f x) = Finset.prod Finset.univ fun (x : ) => g x

                                  Alias of Fintype.prod_equiv.

                                  Fintype.prod_equiv is a specialization of Finset.prod_bij that automatically fills in most arguments.

                                  See Equiv.prod_comp for a version without h.
